facts: Police sought to conduct electronic surveillance
Judge issued warrant based on probable cause affidavit
Warrant particularly described place and things to be searched
Surveillance limited to scope of warrant
asp_facts: case(warrant_requirement). amendment(warrant_requirement, fourth). warrant_obtained(warrant_requirement, yes). probable_cause(warrant_requirement, yes). particular_description(warrant_requirement, yes). neutral_magistrate(warrant_requirement, yes). scope_limited(warrant_requirement, yes). search_reasonable(warrant_requirement, yes).
question: Is surveillance conducted pursuant to a valid warrant consistent with the Fourth Amendment?
rationale: The Fourth Amendment requires that searches and seizures be reasonable. Warrants issued by neutral magistrates based on probable cause and particularly describing the place to be searched and items to be seized satisfy Fourth Amendment requirements. Properly executed warrants make surveillance constitutionally permissible.
